meanings.definition: To grasp or hold with the hands
meanings.sent1: I take the book from the shelf.
meanings.sent2: Can you take my hand, please?
meanings.sent3: He tried to take the slippery fish but it kept slipping away.
meanings.sent4: Her words took hold of my heart like a strong grip.
meanings.sent5: The child's tiny fingers carefully take the delicate flower.

meanings.sent1: I take the gift with gratitude.
meanings.sent2: Will you take this message for me?
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed to take the treat as a token of friendship.
meanings.sent4: His smile took in all the warmth of the room.
meanings.sent5: The student's face lit up as she took the praise from her teacher.

meanings.sent1: I take my backpack to school every day.
meanings.sent2: The truck will take the goods to the warehouse.
meanings.sent3: The ants work together to take the food back to their nest.
meanings.sent4: The wind takes the leaves on a dance through the air.
meanings.sent5: The train will take us to our destination in no time.

meanings.sent1: Please take the trash out of the house.
meanings.sent2: The dentist will take the tooth out gently.
meanings.sent3: She had to take the splinter out of her finger carefully.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to take the rabbit out of thin air.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic will take the engine apart to find the issue.

meanings.sent1: I take a sip of water to quench my thirst.
meanings.sent2: Let's take a break and have some snacks.
meanings.sent3: The cat will take its time to eat the fish.
meanings.sent4: The fire seemed to take the wood into its hungry flames.
meanings.sent5: The baby will take the milk eagerly from the bottle.
